ArticleTitle.sentence: The LysR-type transcriptional regulator CysB controls the repression of hslJ transcription in Escherichia coli.

event.clue: The LysR-type transcriptional regulator CysB controls the repression of hslJ transcription in Escherichia coli.
The LysR-type transcriptional regulator CysB controls the repression of hslJ transcription in Escherichia coli.
The LysR-type transcriptional regulator CysB controls the repression of hslJ transcription in Escherichia coli.

AbstractText.sentence: The LysR-type transcriptional regulator (LTTR) CysB is a transcription factor in Escherichia coli cells, where as a homotetramer it binds the target promoter regions and activates the genes involved in sulphur utilization and sulphonate-sulphur metabolism, while negatively autoregulating its own transcription.

event.clue: The LysR-type transcriptional regulator (LTTR) CysB is a transcription factor in Escherichia coli cells, where as a homotetramer it binds the target promoter regions and activates the genes involved in sulphur utilization and sulphonate-sulphur metabolism, while negatively autoregulating its own transcription.

AbstractText.sentence: The hslJ gene was found to be negatively regulated by CysB and directly correlated with novobiocin resistance of the bacterium.

event.clue: The hslJ gene was found to be negatively regulated by CysB and directly correlated with novobiocin resistance of the bacterium.

AbstractText.sentence: cysB mutants showed upregulation of the hslJ : : lacZ gene fusion and exhibited increased novobiocin resistance.

event.clue: cysB mutants showed upregulation of the hslJ : : lacZ gene fusion and exhibited increased novobiocin resistance.
cysB mutants showed upregulation of the hslJ : : lacZ gene fusion and exhibited increased novobiocin resistance.

AbstractText.sentence: In this study the hslJ transcription start point and the corresponding putative sigma(70) promoter were determined.

The hslJ promoter region was defined by employing different hslJ-lacZ operon fusions, and transcription of the hslJ gene was shown to be subject to both repression imposed by the CysB regulator and direct or indirect autogenous negative control.

event.clue: The hslJ promoter region was defined by employing different hslJ-lacZ operon fusions, and transcription of the hslJ gene was shown to be subject to both repression imposed by the CysB regulator and direct or indirect autogenous negative control.

AbstractText.sentence: These two regulations compete to some extent but they are not mutually exclusive.

event.clue: These two regulations compete to some extent but they are not mutually exclusive.

AbstractText.sentence: CysB acts as a direct repressor of hslJ transcription and binds the hslJ promoter region that carries the putative CysB repressor site.

event.clue: CysB acts as a direct repressor of hslJ transcription and binds the hslJ promoter region that carries the putative CysB repressor site.

AbstractText.sentence: This CysB binding, apparently responsible for repression, is enhanced in the presence of the ligand N-acetylserine (NAS), hitherto considered to be a positive cofactor in CysB-mediated gene regulations.

event.clue: This CysB binding, apparently responsible for repression, is enhanced in the presence of the ligand N-acetylserine (NAS), hitherto considered to be a positive cofactor in CysB-mediated gene regulations.

AbstractText.sentence: Interallelic complementation of characterized CysB mutants I33N and S277Ter partially restored the repression of hslJ transcription and the consequent novobiocin sensitivity, but did not complement the cysteine auxotrophy.

event.clue: Interallelic complementation of characterized CysB mutants I33N and S277Ter partially restored the repression of hslJ transcription and the consequent novobiocin sensitivity, but did not complement the cysteine auxotrophy.
